title: Neuromuscular Physiology and Biomechanics
description: Mechanical properties of structures involved in movement (muscles, tendons, bones). Models of neuromuscular adaptation to chronic electrical stimulation, voluntary exercise, surgical overload, spinal cord injury, denervation, limb immobilization, exercise-induced injury and muscle regeneration. Stem cells in muscle function and plasticity. Prerequisites: graduate standing or consent of instructor.
